noun.description: A native or inhabitant of the Rhineland.
Frequently in form Rheinländer. A variety of polka, originating in Germany in the mid 19th cent.

origin: Early 17th century; earliest use found in Edward Grimeston (fl. 1604–1634), translator. From the name of the Rhineland + -er, after Middle Low German rīnlender or early modern German Reinlender, Rheinlender (German Rheinländer).
